image.altText: Health care worker Desleigh Shields listens to a patient's heartbeat.

props.synopsis: The first drop of Closing the Gap target data for 2024 provides updates for eight of the 19 socio-economic targets, showing the agreement is not on track.

title.children: Latest Closing the Gap data shows only five out of 19 targets are 'on track'. Will the next generation get a fair go?

image.altText: A headshot of Karen who wears a red blazer and stands with a serious expression in a living room infront of an arched window.

props.synopsis: The peak body for GPs says female doctors are earning less than their male colleagues because they're more likely to take on appointments for things like mental health and antenatal care, which attract lower bulk billing incentives.

title.children: 'It's medical misogyny': Doctors say Medicare bulk billing incentives exacerbating GP gender pay gap

image.altText: A jogger runs along the shore of Manly Beach after sunrise on the first day of Spring in Sydney, 2008

props.synopsis: As Victorians head into a hot and dry Labour Day long weekend, authorities are urging people to avoid travelling to state parks and forests if they don't need to, and advising festival-goers to prepare for temperatures of up to 40 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Victorians urged to stay away from state forests this weekend as temperatures hit 40 degrees

image.altText: Nikki Haley stands at a podium bearing her name in front of a row of American flags.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's last rival for the Republican presidential nominationÂ suspends her US presidential campaign but stops short of endorsing the former president, arguing he needs to "earn the votes" of Americans who don't support him.

title.children: Nikki Haley suspends presidential campaign, leaving Donald Trump as last major Republican candidate

image.altText: Two images: Vladimir Putn speaking at a podium in front of a Russian flag, and Joe Biden speaking in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin's spokesperson claims Russia has never interfered in a US election â but that's not what US intelligence officials believe.

title.children: Russia 'does not intend to interfere' in 2024 US presidential election, Kremlin says

image.altText: Three children sit with their hands cable tied. Their faces are blurred.

title.children: WA's premier 'disturbed' by confronting vision of kids cable tied together in state's north

image.altText: Roshni Lad laying on a hospital bed wearing a pink shirt with her husband Bhairav beside her.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne couple say they were "praying to God" for the safe delivery of their baby after being forced to pull over on the side of the road to give birth amid traffic chaos they say was caused by a climate protest on Tuesday.

title.children: Baby boy born on side of busy Melbourne road amid climate protest which caused traffic delay

image.altText: Alex Prestney wearing a police uniform walking next to Belinda and Andrew Prestney outside court.

props.synopsis: A trucking boss avoids a prison term, despite allowing a drug-affected driver to get behind the wheel in the lead-up to Melbourne's Eastern Freeway tragedy where four police officers were killed.

title.children: 'Totally absurd': Family of police officer killed in freeway crash speaks after trucking boss spared jail

image.altText: A woman writes well messages on the message board during the tenth annual remembrance event at a shopping mall.

props.synopsis: New deep-sea technology and different crash theories will be used as two more companies undertake bids to find the wreckage of doomed flight MH370.

title.children: 'Extremely rough terrain' flagged as new search area for MH370

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A man wearing a face mask is looking at a Southern Cross Station train platform

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Southern Cross Station is a gateway for commuters and visitors to the city, but experts say secret data shows the air quality poses a health risk to workers and passengers.

title.children: Melbourne's Southern Cross Station is notorious for its smell â now air quality data shows why

image.altText: A composite image shows photographs of a woman with a magnifying glass over one photo.

props.synopsis: The suspected homicide of a woman with disabilities is raising questions about how her disappearance slipped through the cracks.

title.children: Tanya Glover vanished. No-one reported her missing. 13 years later, her body was found

image.altText: former prison officer wayne astill sits outdoors at a cafe table

image.altText: A graphic map of Australian showing the Great Artesian Basin and a "CO2" graphic with downward arrows.

props.synopsis: The Great Artesian Basin generates about $13 billion of product and supplies water to hundreds of towns, but a big coal company wants to store waste CO2 in it.

title.children: Should Australia's largest groundwater system be used to produce food or store waste CO2?Â

image.altText: A sign reads 'BEAUMARIS PRIMARY SCHOOL' behind gum leaves.

props.synopsis: A Board of Inquiry into historical child sexual abuse at Beaumaris Primary School and 23 other schools has recommended the Victorian government formally apologise to victim-survivors. The inquiry revealed one paedophile teacher was linked to the abuse of 60 individuals.

title.children: Notorious paedophile teacher was linked to abuse of 60 children in Victorian schools, inquiry finds

image.altText: A wide shot of five men in suits and ties standing in a line, crossing their arms and joining hands while smiling

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and South-East Asian leaders endorseÂ a declaration that omits some language on China that Australia originally wanted included.

title.children: Australia and South-East Asian nations endorse watered-down declaration to strengthen regional ties

image.altText: Man with a cattle hat leans smiling against a rail

props.synopsis: Nobby the night watchman has been coming to the High Country cattle sales for 40 years, and keeping the cattle safe at night for 10. He says: "I'll be coming here till the day I die".

title.children: Behind the scenes at every cattle sale is the man who keeps the animals safe at night

image.altText: A medium shot of a middle-aged man in a suit and tie sitting in a chair

image.altText: Sue and Lloyd Clarke

title.children: Hannah Clarke's parents will not stop fighting until coercive control is criminalised across Australia

image.altText: A vector illustration of blue, red and grey lines laid over spherical glowing 3D world map on plain black background.

title.children: Mother shares traumatic story of rushing daughter to hospital in town with no ambulance station

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

image.altText: Escalators at Carindale shopping centre busy with Christmas shoppers

title.children: We're experiencing the biggest dive in living standards in half a century â and a recession is looming

image.altText: Taryn Brumfitt sitting on a towel in a timber sauna wearing black one-piece swimmers. She holds a book and smiles to the camera.
